channel.title: MSDN: Visual Studio 2005
channel.description: The latest information for developers on Visual Studio 2005 (codenamed "Whidbey").

item.title: Help Integration Tool for Visual Studio 2005 Beta Products
item.description: Safari’s Visual Studio Help Integration (VSHI) tool lets you search across Safari’s online repository of over 2000 technical titles to find exactly the example or code fragment you need to answer the question at hand. Register today to download the free Safari VSHI trial version and gain full access to Safari’s e-reference library for 30 days at no charge.

item.title: MSDN TV: Writing Managed Code for SQL Server 2005 Using Visual Studio 2005
item.description: SQL Server 2005 allows users to write managed code that runs on the server. Visual Studio 2005 makes it easy to build stored procedures, functions, triggers, data types and aggregates in managed code. Milind Lele shows how to create, deploy, and debug a user defined data type (UDT) in Visual Basic.

item.title: Nothin' But ASP.NET: Use Cache, Save Cash
item.description: Learn how to use database cache invalidation in ASP.NET 1.1 with a similar technique as the one used by ASP.NET 2.0.

item.title: Working with the ASP.NET 2.0 ObjectDataSource Control
item.description: Learn how to use the ObjectDataSource control to build a proper multi-tier Web application with the ASP.NET 2.0 Framework.

item.title: MSDN TV: Drag Once Databinding for Client Apps
item.description: Visual Studio 2005 introduces a new set of features to quickly build data-bound applications. In this episode, Steve Lasker demonstrates the Drag Once Databinding features, including some enhancements since Beta 1.

item.title: Introducing the ASP.NET 2.0 Web Parts Framework
item.description: Web Parts provide you with the infrastructure for creating customizable Web applications. When you build a Web site with Web Parts, the Web site can be easily customized by either the administrator of the Web site or the individual users of the Web site. Web Parts are all about flexibility.

item.title: ASP.NET 2.0 Localization Features: A Fresh Approach to Localizing Web Applications
item.description: Creating global Web applications with Microsoft ASP.NET is becoming more and more important. ASP.NET 2.0 makes it even easier to provide support for multiple cultures and locales through improved runtime and tool support.

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Chris Sells Checks In
item.description: .NET Rocks! regular guest Chris Sells joins Carl and the gang for a discussion about Longhorn and WinFX, Longhorn features on XP, working on the MSDN Smart Client DevCenter, VS.NET 2005, learning about new technologies, learning by teaching, and Avalon.

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Chris Sells Checks In
item.description: .NET Rocks! regular guest Chris Sells joins Carl and the gang for a discussion about Longhorn and WinFX, Longhorn features on XP, working on the MSDN Smart Client DevCenter, VS.NET 2005, learning about new technologies, learning by teaching, and Avalon.

item.title: Creating Web Application Themes in ASP.NET 2.0
item.description: Learn to use cascading style sheets and images with themes in ASP.NET 2.0, and how you can dynamically load themes at run time.
